titleStmt.title:
A Song──Occasion'd by a Sermon
preach'd by Dr 08. Delany an Irish
Clergyman, wherein he exhorts the
Ladies to suckle their Children.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: By Dr Swift
To the Tune of──Mad Moll.

1
O my Kitten a Kitten, & O my deary a deary
Such a sweet pet as this there is not far nor neary.
Here we go up, up, up, & here we go down a down downy,
Here we go backwards & forwards, & here we go round a round roundy
2_Chicky Chuckoo, my Lilly cock, see saw saccary downy,
Gallop a trot trot trot & hey for Dublin Towny,
This Pig went to Market, creep Mouse Mousy Mousy,
Shoo, shoo, shoo the wild Colt, here is mine own Doll dowsy.
3_We was a Iewel & pretty, & we was a Sugar & Spicy,
Hush a by by in a Cradle, & we'll go abroad in a Tricy────
Did e Pappa torment it, did he vex Baby, did he,
Hushy in Mamma's none bosom, & take a nown suck a diddy.
4_Good Morrow, oh there's a Pudding broke, slabbers a Thread of Chrystal,
See the sweet Posset comes up, who said my Child was bepist all;
Water my Chickens, come clack, leave off or I'll scrawl you I'll scrawl you
Give me a hand & I'll beat him, go, go, wḍ you vex my Baby.
5_We was a Pug & a Crow, we was a giggling Bonny
Goody, good Child shall be fed, but naughty Pack shall have noney.
Get you gone raw head & bloody bones, here is a Child that don't fear'ee
Come pissy, pissy my Iewel & a, a, a my Deary.
